compilo

Class LexicalAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • compilo.LexicalAnalyzer

  • public class LexicalAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object
    Lexical analyzer implementing the DFA.

    This analyzes the lexical content of the code entered by the user. It also feed the table of symbols with identifiers, images and number of line.

    Author:
    Quentin Delhaye
    See Also:
    SymbolsTable

      • nextToken

        public java.lang.String[] nextToken(java.lang.String input,
                           boolean newLine,
                           int lineNum)

        Analyzes the String it is feed with.

        It begins by checking either the input is a comment or not. If not, it splits it and begins the analysis. As soon as a token is recognized, the method gives it back to the caller along the corresponding lexical unit.

        It will also feed the table of symbols with various couple of identifier/image or identifier/line number.

        Parameters:
        input - String to analyze.
        newLine - Boolean telling if the input String is the beginning of a new line or not. Useful for the isComment() method.
        lineNum - Line of the current String being analyzed. Useful for the table of symbols.
        Returns:
        Array containing the result of the analysis:
        • [0]: token.
        • [1]: lexical unit.
        See Also:
        SymbolsTable.addLabel(java.lang.String[]), SymbolsTable.addVariable(java.lang.String[])

      • searchTokenType

        private java.lang.String[] searchTokenType(java.lang.String[] couple)

        public void printSymbolsTable()
